Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (part of tail and hindquarters with added red blobs remaining) to right; part of pendant roundel and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '21' is written in ink on a paper label glued to the interior surface. For parallels regarding the bull, see British Museum 1923,1210.24 and 1923,1210.18.
